Author: IamSumbuny

Comment: Good idea in principle but a colossal PITA for most retailers with tariffs changing on a daily basis and having several layers of effects throughout supply chains. Many companies are already struggling to stay on top of these revolving tariff changes simply in the extra work it takes just to get the products made and shipped, constantly updating price lists, etc, and it's already basically whack-a-mole just to keep up.  Aside from that, there's some extra confusion because the importer pays the tariff. Well in a supply chain, that could be the same entity that's selling the product or the retailer may be a few degrees removed from that. So you'd end up with sort of a mish mash where a lot of products don't *look* tariffed because the final retailer doesn't actually know what the tariff rates were, but the products are absolutely more expensive anyway.  Some companies may have just one or two factories or key suppliers so maybe it's not that hard to track, but for many it would be a total nightmare.
